pullRequest.title: Add postgres.properties template to README and allow users to omit fhir truststore
pullRequest.bodyText:
Omitting the truststore will result in the client using the default java
cacerts truststore which works will any of our cloud deploys.
I also allowed my editor to apply the "remove trailing whitespace"
action
Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant lmsurpre@us.ibm.com

commit.message:
Add postgres.proprties template to README and allow users to omit fhir
truststore

Omitting the truststore will result in the client using the default java
cacerts truststore which works will any of our cloud deploys.

I also allowed my editor to apply the "remove trailing whitespace"
action

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

remove commented out code

added a TODO to handle keystore for mTLS

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

beforeCommit.message:
remove commented out code

Except for one place where I explicitly label it as a TODO

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
remove commented out code

added a TODO to handle keystore for mTLS

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

commit.message:
gitignore db properties files

added db2.properties and postgres.properties to fhir-persistence-schema
gitignores to be consistent with the `.gitignore` edits I just made for
fhir-bucket

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
